Title: Adding New Scripts
Subject Line: How to Add Scripts Using Claude Code
Content:
To add new scripts to the Triple R Ambassador plugin:

  1. Open Claude Code and connect to the triplermarketing-scripts repository on GitHub
  2. Tell Claude what script you want to add in natural language, for example:
  3. "Add a new script with Title 'Welcome Email', Category 'Greetings', Subject Line 'Welcome to Our Team!', Content '...your email text...', and assign it to the general role"
  4. Claude will edit the appropriate faqs/{role}.json file and commit the changes
  5. Once pushed, the new script will be available to users with that role

Tip: You can add multiple scripts at once by listing them all in your request.

Title: Managing Users
Subject Line: How to Manage Users Using Claude Code
Content:
To manage users for the Triple R Ambassador plugin:

Adding a new user:

Tell Claude: "Create a new user named John Smith with the general role"

Claude will generate a UUID API key and create a file in the users/ folder.

Updating a user:

Tell Claude: "Add the admin role to user John Smith" or "Disable the user with API key abc123..."

Deleting a user:

Tell Claude: "Delete the user named John Smith" or "Remove the user file for API key abc123..."

Listing users:

Ask Claude: "What users exist?" or "Show me all users and their roles"

All changes are committed to GitHub and take effect once the GitHub Pages cache updates (usually within minutes).

Title: Managing Roles
Subject Line: How to Manage Roles Using Claude Code
Content:
To manage roles for the Triple R Ambassador plugin:

Creating a new role:

Tell Claude: "Create a new role called 'sales' with description 'Sales team scripts'"

Claude will update roles.json and create an empty faqs/sales.json file.

Assigning roles to users:

Tell Claude: "Give the sales role to user Jane Doe"

Viewing roles:

Ask Claude: "What roles exist?" or "Show me all roles and their descriptions"

Deleting a role:

Tell Claude: "Delete the sales role"

Note: This will also remove the associated faqs file. Make sure no users depend on it first.

Remember: Users only see scripts for roles they're assigned to. The 'general' role is typically given to all users.
